page.title: 13Fruit Farm- Harvesting
page.content: Fruit Farm - Harvesting Harvesting is from early September to late October, the dates determined by starch-testing the fruit. Part of the crop is picked by P.Y.O. customers and the remainder by 20 local women. Current casual labour wages are Â£l.94/hour although for apple harvesting a price is paid for bulk bin picked. The crop is stored in these , which hold about 600 lbs. Barn storing gives a better ripening process and many customers buy in bulk to continue the storage process. October to the end of March sees the packing and marketing of the fruit. Much is sold directly to the public and wholesalers from the farm shop, excess is marketed in Hereford or Cardiff. Surplus Golden Delicious are sent to Ledbury for babyfoods.
